name: Behavioral Health
description: San Francisco Health Network behavioral health services are here to support you and your family with mental health or substance use issues. Call clinic to ask about whether they offer mental health services or refer out.
fullDescription: San Francisco Health Network behavioral health services are here to support you and your family with mental health or substance use issues. Call clinic to ask about whether they offer mental health services or refer out.
whatTheyOffer: San Francisco Health Network behavioral health services are here to support you and your family with mental health or substance use issues. Call clinic to ask about whether they offer mental health services or refer out.
howToGetIt: You must be getting care at one of our SFHN clinics to receive this service. Referrals are needed Speak to your current health provider at your clinic to get a referral. 1. Enroll in the SF Health Network Mental health and substance abuse services, also known as Primary Care Behavioral Health (PCBH) services, are available to patients who are enrolled at a SF Health Network (SFHN) primary care clinic. SFHN Enrollment 628-206-7800 2. Speak to your health provider Your primary care provider (PCP) will discuss your concerns with you and can refer you to PCBH services. Primary Care Behavioral Health (PCBH) staff can meet with you in person, by televideo, or by telephone depending on your needs. Suicide Prevention offers telephone crisis counseling all day, every day: (415) 781-0500 Visit Here: https://sfhealthnetwork.org/about-sfhn/mental-health-crisis/ to check out other services available to help you during a mental health crisis
